title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling the class using the 'ajc' command without the '-d' option, the subpackage\Test.java file is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory.
EB: When compiling the class using the 'ajc' command with the '-d' option, the 'subpackage' directory should be created under the specified <output_directory> and the subpackage\Test.java file should be placed inside it.
SR: Use the command 'ajc -d <output_directory> subpackage\Test.java' to correctly compile the class from the subpackage.
